@Argentina Shades of versus Cameroon in 1990, freak match. 
You had the ball in the net FOUR times 1st half, 1 goal & one dodgy VAR decision against Martinez.
You cannot allow one of the greatest ever, in perhaps his final World Cup, to leave like this.
Go again and two winnable games left.

@ITV Prediction:
Senegal 1 - 3 Netherlands

Senegal will still be dangerous, but I see the Netherlands proving to be too much for them.
Mane is such a big miss and the Netherlands could be a dark horse this tournament to go very far.
@ITV It's whatever Qatar says it is.. Lol
RT @JimsRetroEmp: What was the first video game you ever played? https://t.co/YNwXwvspnJ

@talkSPORT Seeing a back 4, Bellingham and Saka outstanding, the real standouts.
Promising, but wouldn't get carried away.
There were a number of lapses defensively against a poor side and so I question that.
Good from Southgate though and subs all contributed well.

@talkSPORT Great win but should've been 6-1 penalty for Iran was farce and smelt more of pleasing the majority crowd.
Maguire penalty appeal far more obvious...

@England Prediction:
England 2 - 1 Iran

A tricky potential banana skin here.
Iran organised and gave Portugal problems last WC.
England may have to overcome adversity in a narrow win...

@victoriabeckham Pass it onto David Beckham, I agree with @joelycett that he's a massive sellout.
An exceptional footballer and one of the best ever to wear the shirt. But in supporting a regime with such despicable laws & attitudes, alienating fans globally, he's effectively staining his legacy.
@joelycett #WellDoneJoeLycett 👏

@joelycett See, shredding £10, 000 at first glance is repulsive, but in this case it's an investment in creating, debate, discussion and change.
And surely is it not more repulsive, the views and laws alienating a whole ton of fans, whilst FIFA falsely preach about inclusion? 🤔

@Hayshometruths That's the tweet.
Beckham just showing he can be bought, just like FIFA were...
